info.title: Know your customer API
info.description:
Uniform Trustlink APIs to verify your customer. These APIs are provided by a number of Trustlink's partners. You will be able to switch API publishers by changing the 'publisher' header. 

# Features
![ID Verification](https://marketplace.trustlinkhosting.com/images/Trustlink/KYC/IDVerification1.png)
* Verify an exact match with provided ID Number, Firstname and Surname against publisher DB.
* Verify a scored match with provided ID Number, Firstname and Surname against publisher DB.
* Check deceased status against publisher DB.

score.description: Score if request had options.matchType == scored.

status.description: Status of the individual at Home Affairs

marriedDate.description: Date of marriage (YYYY-MM-DD). If requested, but not recorded, the field will not be present.

marriedPlace.description: Place of Marriage. If requested, but not recorded the field will not be present.

deceasedDate.description: Date of death (YYYY-MM-DD). If requested, but not recorded OR the person is not deceased, the field will not be present.

initials.description: Initials as per Home Affairs. If requested, but not recorded the field will not be present.

cost.description: Cost in API credits charged for the request.

tier.description: Current Tier level for the API Organization.

credits.description: Number of API credits remaining after the call was processed.

apimStatus.title: Status
apimStatus.description:
All responses from the marketplace will at least contain the *apimStatus* object.  The purpose is to inform the requester of status details above and beyond the HTTP status code.

Note that it is possible to have a success indicator on the marketplace layer, but have a unsuccessful indication on the *providerCode*. This in essence means that even if the API to the provider returned for example a 'not found' result, the request is still chargable on the marketplace layer.

The *providerCode* will only be present if the API was routed to the API Provider.

## Marketplace Codes

| Code | Description |
|------|---------------|
| 200 | Successfully serviced and charged. |
| 250 | Successfully serviced with no charge. |
| 401 | Unauthorized.  |
| 404 | Not Found. |
| 450 | Application Not Found. |
| 451 | Organization Not Found. |
| 500 | Internal Server Error. |

marketplaceCode.description: Indicates status on the marketplace layer.
marketplaceCode.title: Markerplace layer status code

marketplaceMsg.title: Human readable message to provide more details on the *marketplaceCode*.
marketplaceMsg.example: An API subscription application for the requested URI was not found.
marketplaceMsg.description: Human readable description providing details about the error. On success the value will be 'Success'

providerCode.description: Error code returned API provider. The value is of type string seeing as the prodiver might respond with a string error code like 'ERRDB01'

statusCode.description: Same as the http status code

marketplaceId.description: Marketplace request id for support and tracing queries.

marketplaceMocked.description:
Indicates if the response was generated by a marketplace mockup. This is only relevant to API that start with the /storefront and /sandbox paths. 
If true, the API was not passed on to the API provider backend, but the response is being mocked up the marketplace.
If false, it indicates that the API call was pushed through to the API provider backend. The backend in turn might have stubbed the response in order to prevent costs like SMS notifications.

post.description:
Verify ID Number and Name information with options for different matching parameters.

## Billing
The following API request will be charged
* ID Numbers that fails the check digit validation.
* ID Numbers not found on the publisher database.

parameters.name: body

allOf.title: Person
allOf.description: Basic representation of a person containing basic data.

_id.description: A system specific id number. This is not the persons' official form of identification number.

middleNames.description:
Names remaining after removing the first name and last name.
This can be a string 
* with multiple names separated with spaces 
* contains a single name
OR an array containing each middle name as a separate item

lastName.description: Also known as surname or family name.

dateOfBirth.title: Unambiguous date format
dateOfBirth.description: Used to ensure date entry in an unambiguous format

idNumber.description: Identification Number as issued by goverment.

passportCountry.description: Passport country of issue code as per ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-3)

options.description: Options that can be specified to the verification API

matchType.description: Should the firstName + lastName be an exact or scored match.

responseFields.description: List of fields to return if there is an exact / score == 1  match.

consent.title: Consent
consent.description: In many cases calls on the Marketplace will client consent. In these cases the method must be recorded.

method.description: Where consent is required for using an individuals data, the method of consent needs to be recorded.

otherMethod.description: Form of consent to be detailed if *method=other*

date.title: Unambiguous date format
date.description: Used to ensure date entry in an unambiguous format

url.description: URL where Terms and Conditions that specifies the consent can be viewed.

parameters.description:
The request uses the standard Person data model, but has the following additional required nodes:
* idNumber

### Options
#### matchType
##### exact (Default)
For this method the Person.idNumber, Person.firstName and Person.lastName must match the record of the publisher exactly. Note that accented letters in the name like ,  will be normalized to e on both the input and publisher data data side before compare.

A match will return an HTTP 200 response, but a mismatch will return a 404.

##### scored
For this method the Person.firstName and Person.lastName assoiciated with the provided Person.idNumber with be subjected to a [Jaro-Winkler distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jaro%E2%80%93Winkler_distance) calculation.

If the idNumber was not found at all an HTTP 404 is returned. 

If the idNumber was found a 'score' is returned in the HTTP 200. The 'score' is the inverse of the Jaro distance, thus
* score = 0 is an absolute no match
* score = 100 is a 100% match
* anything in between will give an indication of the match strength

* Examples
** Coming Soon!!!
